intro: Saussurea tianshuiensis var. huxianensis, commonly known as the Huxian safflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its botanical features include fibrous roots and a compact inflorescence with numerous ray florets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
